metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12405 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 63 and Firefox ESR 60.3. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort thatsome of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerabilityaffects Thunderbird < 60.4, Firefox ESR < 60.4, and Firefox < 64.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12405` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
